p: Variation in environmental conditions across space can result in local adaptation, where populations are more fit to the environment in which they evolved ( Kawecki and Ebert, 2004). With climatic conditions changing at an alarming rate ( Diffenbaugh et al., 2018), populations will need to migrate to more favorable climates, modify their phenotypes via plasticity or evolutionary change, or face extinction ( Hoffmann and Sgro, 2011; Waldvogel et al., 2020). Thus, understanding the causes and consequences of local climate adaptation is fundamental to predict species responses to future changes in climate.
